snippet: Gov. Chris Christie agreed to expand New Jersey’s program, but stopped short of what some parents say is necessary to improve their children’s access to treatment.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie agrees to lift some restrictions on state's medical marijuana program, but stops short of what parents of children with life-threatening diseases say is necessary to improve their access to treatment; program requires that parents obtain letters from pediatrician and psychiatrist as well as doctor, requirement seen by many as prohibitive.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie agreed to expand New Jersey’s program, but stopped short of what some parents say is necessary to improve their children’s access to treatment.
